metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5135 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WebKit/Source/core/html/parser/HTMLPreloadScanner.cpp in Blink, as used in Google Chrome before 52.0.2743.82, does not consider referrer-policy information inside an HTML document during a preload request, which allows remote attackers to bypass the Content Security Policy (CSP) protection mechanism via a crafted web site, as demonstrated by a "Content-Security-Policy: referrer origin-when-cross-origin" header that overrides a "<META name='referrer' content='no-referrer'>" element.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5135` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-browser-l10n - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-chromedriver - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.16.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.16.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.16.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.16.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.16.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
